metadata.feature_description: Extensible plugin system allowing additional JavaScript modules to enhance connector functionality.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Connector loads and initializes plugin architecture

steps.action: Navigate to Connectors page and click Edit on Google Analytics 4 connector
steps.expected: Connector configuration UI loads successfully, which triggers the loadPlugins function in connector.js
steps.actual: Connector configuration panel expanded successfully showing Measurement ID field and Track for Administrators checkbox. The connector UI loaded without errors.

steps.action: Verify connector UI is fully functional and check console for plugin-related errors
steps.expected: No plugin-related errors in console, connector functions normally
steps.actual: Console shows no plugin-related errors. Only unrelated errors (404 for cavalier-logo.png, jQuery migrate messages). The plugin architecture silently handles the empty plugin list as expected.

observations: The Plugin Architecture Support is an infrastructure/extensibility feature implemented in connector.js (lines 74-90) and ServicesController.cs (lines 63-75).
The GetPlugins API endpoint scans the Scripts folder for .js files, excludes 'connector.js', and returns the remaining files for dynamic loading.
Currently, only connector.js exists in the Scripts folder (Evoq Content/Connectors/GoogleAnalytics/Scripts/), so the plugin list is empty - this is expected behavior.
The plugin initialization code (initializePlugins function) calls the 'init' method on each loaded plugin with the connector context (bindViewModel, helper, rootFolder, utility).
No UI elements exist specifically for plugin management - plugins are automatically loaded when the connector initializes.
The feature is designed for extensibility: developers can add additional .js files to the Scripts folder to extend connector functionality without modifying the core connector code.
